author: cms-externals
body:
See this log for example: https://cmssdt.cern.ch/SDT/cgi-bin/logreader/el10_amd64_gcc14/CMSSW_15_1_ROOT636_X_2025-07-15-1100/unitTestLogs/PhysicsTools/TensorFlowAOT#/84-84

Python's `platform.processor` on Linux calls `uname -p`, which returns `unknown` in EL10 (and returns `x86_64` in EL9 and older). This is [not a bug](https://docs.redhat.com/en/documentation/red_hat_enterprise_linux/10/html/10.0_release_notes/known-issues), but rather a fix for non-portable behavior - the right way is to call `uname -m` (or `platform.machine()`). 

If it's okay, I'll change the code to only use `platform.machine()` instead of trying `platform.processor()` first
title: Use platform.machine() if platform.processor returns empty string
